admissions.title: Mobility Rules
admissions.description: The external mobility of the spring semester of the 2022 - 2023 academic year begins at Alte University
admissions.content:
Mobility Rules

The external mobility of the spring semester of the 2022–2023 academic year begins at Alte University.

Students wishing to transfer to Alte University for external mobility in the spring semester of the 2022-2023 academic year must register on the electronic portal At the time of registration, students should indicate Alte University as the first place in the list of universities.

External mobility registration period: from January 30, 2023, at 12:00 p.m. to February 8, 2023, at 6:00 PM.

Students who are eligible to transfer to Alte University must apply between February 10 and February 13.

Applicants can send their application either by bringing it to the university or sending it by e-mail: n.chanturia@alte.edu.ge

A student wishing to be transferred will get acquainted with the prepared report on the recognition of credits and will confirm by signing his consent to enroll in Alte University on the basis of mobility.

Documents required for enrollment are:

  • Statement addressed to the president of the university (please see the attachment at the bottom of the page)

  • Copy of ID

  • Certificate / Diploma (copy)

  • Student study card

  • A copy of the enrollment order from the home university

  • Certificate of student status

  • Copy of pre-conscription military registration certificate (for boys)

Documents to be submitted after enrollment:

  • Certificate(original) or notarized diploma copy

  • 2 pieces of 3X4photo

Programs and admission places

admissions.title: Admission rules for international students
admissions.description: About application steps for transfer students
admissions.content:
Admission Rules for International Students

About application steps for transfer students:

Step 1: filling out the online registration form (Agency number for direct students is: 10000. If you apply through the Agency, please make sure to request the special agency number from them)

Step 2: collecting the below-mentioned documents:

  • Your passport (with a valid expiration date);

  • Full university transcript (make sure to submit a signed and stamped version);

  • A Filled-out application form (make sure to check your chosen program correctly).

Step 3: submitting all the collected documents to the following email address transfers@alte.edu.ge

Note: In the subject section of the email, please include your name, surname, passport number, and the program you are applying for (MD or Dentistry).

About application timeframes for transfer students:

  • After you provide all the required documents, we will get back to you with the credit recognition results within one week;

  • If you accept our offer, in one or two business days you will receive the letter of conditional acceptance with all the negotiated terms;

  • After initiating the payment, our admissions office will further process the application and submit it to the Ministry of Education of Georgia. The official results are normally available within one month;

  • Invitation letters will be sent to you within 3 business days after we have received confirmation from the ministry about your enrollment.

About application steps for first-year applicants:

Step 1: filling out the online registration form (Agency number for direct students is: 10000. If you apply through the Agency, please make sure to request the special agency number from them)

Step 2: collecting the below-mentioned documents:

  • Your passport (with a valid expiration date);

  • Full university transcript (make sure to submit a signed and stamped version);

  • A Filled-out application form (make sure to check your chosen program correctly). Skype ID (for interview purposes).

Step 3: submitting all the collected documents to the following email address admissions@alte.edu.ge

Note: In the subject section of the email, please include your name, surname, passport number, and the program you are applying for (MD or Dentistry).

About application timeframes for first-year applicants:

  • After you provide all the necessary documents, our admissions team will invite you to the interview within three business days;

  • If you accept our offer, in one or two business days you will receive the letter of interview confirmation and the letter of conditional acceptance with the listed conditions;

  • After initiating the payment, our admissions office will further process the application and submit it to the Ministry of Education of Georgia. The official results are normally available within one month;

  • Invitation letters will be sent to you within 3 business days after we have received confirmation from the ministry about your enrollment.

About fees:

  • One-time application fee: $180 (for transfer students only)

  • One-time application fee: $100 (for first-year applicants)

Note: Please make sure to contact our admissions office to get information about program-specific fees and charges.

admissions.title: Undergraduate Program Admission
admissions.description: Enrollment in undergraduate programs of Alte University is based on the results of unified national exams or in accordance with other rules established by the legislation of Georgia.
admissions.content:
Undergraduate Program Admission

Enrollment in undergraduate programs of Alte University is based on the results of unified national exams or in accordance with other rules established by the legislation of Georgia. An entrant who successfully passed the unified national exams applies to Alte University with an application for enrollment at the Alte university or fills out an electronic application form from the university's website.

Registration deadlines for those wishing to enroll in undergraduate programs at Alte University:

  • Administrative registration: August 29 - September 1

  • Academic registration (for freshman and high school students): September 5-7

A bachelor's candidate who has successfully passed the unified national exams applies to the university with an application for enrollment and presents the following documents:

  • Statement

  •  Copy Of ID Card

  • High school graduation certificate (Original) or vocational education diploma (Original)

  • Color photo-image 2 pieces, size 3 X 4 printed and an electronic version on disk

  • Copy of military registration certificate (For Boys) in the case of minor students, a parent ID card, or guardian ID card.

Applicants must submit all required documents within the time frame set for administrative registration. In case of non-submission of documents, the enrollment order is canceled in the enrollment part of the respective entrant.
An entrant who does not apply to the university within the registration period and consequently cannot be placed in the order of the rector is entitled to submit an application for enrollment from the issuance of the unified act of the president until June of the following year.


Note: Enrollment of the entrant in this way excludes the possibility of using the obtained state education grant.

admissions.title: Master's Program Admission
admissions.description: Those wishing to pass the common master exam in 2022 will be selected by only one type of test.
admissions.content:
Master's Program Admission

Those wishing to pass the common master exam in 2022 will be selected by only one type of test. The test will still consist of 4 Parts: reading comprehension, analytical writing, logical reasoning, and quantitative reasoning. See the common master's exam Guide. 

The competition for enrollment in the master's program is open to anyone from any profession who exceeds the minimum competency threshold for the common master's exams in at least 3 of the 4 parts of the examination test. On the other hand, Alte University does not specify a higher level of competence in any part of the test and does not specify which three parts of the test must be exceeded.


It should be noted that having a bachelor's degree in law is a prerequisite for enrollment in the master of laws program.

Acceptance of documents (administrative registration) for those wishing to enroll in the master's program of Alte University is carried out from August 22 to September 16, in two stages:


  • First stage: August 22 - September 5

  • Second stage: September 9 - 16

A master's candidate who has successfully passed the common master's exam will apply to the university for enrollment and submit the following documents:

  • Application for enrollment (see attached file)

  • Copy of ID card

  • Autobiography (CV)

  • Color photograph 1 piece, size 3 X 4

  • printed and an electronic version on disk

  • Copy of military registration certificate (for boys)

  • Diploma notarized copy 

  • Diploma Supplement (Copy)

  • An extract of the results of the common master's examinations

To be admitted to the Master's program in National and International Security, Business Administration, and Law, it is necessary for the candidate to successfully pass an interview with the members of the commission to confirm professional knowledge and English language proficiency (B2 level).


Documents are accepted Monday through Friday (10:00-18:00) at University St. # 2 (Alte University Campus). You can also send documents to the email address masters@alte.edu.ge

faq.question: Does Alte University have exchange programs?
faq.answer:
Alte University, with its extensive international institutional collaboration and strategic partners in the local and international markets, can attract both international students, researchers, and professors, as well as provide foreign experience to its students and science.


There is a Confucius institute at Alte University, where anyone can master the Chinese language and then continue their studies in China with 100% funding. In addition, Alte University also offers exchange programs with partner universities in Europe, Asia, and the Caucasus.

news.title: Opening of Human Rights Media Lab
news.description: The first Human Right Media Lab opened at ALTE University with an initiative of Rights Georgia.
news.content: The first Human Right Media Lab opened at ALTE University with an initiative of Rights Georgia. An idea was financially supported by the Embassy of the Netherlands. Additionally, Rights Georgia presented the findings of large research into legalistic and practical deficiencies of freedom of expression in Georgia. Media Lab was opened by the Ambassador of the Netherlands Maaike van Koldam, President of the ALTE University Ramaz Kukuladze and Executive Director of “Rights Georgia” Lado Mkervalishvili.

news.description: The International Medical School of ALTE University has important news for Georgian and foreign students and for people who are interested in the medical sphere. If you want to continue studying at a residency program in the USA, USMLE (United States Medical Licensed Examination) is the right choice for you! This is a course which will help you to expand your knowledge on important issues of examination.
news.title: USMLE - United States Medical Licensed Examination
news.content:
The International Medical School of ALTE University has important news for Georgian and foreign students and for people who are interested in the medical sphere. If you want to continue studying at a residency program in the USA, USMLE (United States Medical Licensed Examination) is the right choice for you! This is a course which will help you to expand your knowledge on important issues of examination. Additionally, we have to mention that the university administration will guide you through the registration process. Note: if you want to pass the USMLE Examination and study abroad, ECFMG (Educational Commission for Foreign Medical Graduates) Accreditation is of crucial importance for the overall process. The registration form of accreditation should be filled with an educational institution that is a member of the World Directory of Medical School and of course, we do!

The program of International Medical School of ALTE University is accredited by WFME (WorldFederation of Medical Education) which means Internationally Accredited Education in Georgia. Offers for the students of International Medical School of ALTE University: TOP 3 students with high academic achievements of ALTE University will study for free in the USMLE preparation program. All students of ALTE University will get a 50% discount. For detailed information, contact the Dean of International Medical School, Jilda Cheishvili: j.cheishvili@alte.edu.ge

news.title: Memorandum with Bharath Institute of Higher Education and Research
news.description: ALTE University announces that the memorandum of understanding was signed between Bharath Institute of Higher Education and Research and ALTE University. It concentrates on the following directions: exchanging students and faculty members of medical school, creating joint programs in IT and Data Science;...
news.content:
ALTE University announces that the memorandum of understanding was signed between Bharath Institute of Higher Education and Research and ALTE University. It concentrates on the following directions: exchanging students and faculty members of medical school, creating joint programs in IT and Data Science; offering clinical practice for medical students in the respective hospitals in Georgia and India; organizing joint academic conferences, seminars, workshops. 

Bharath Institute of Higher Education and Research was founded in 1984. It is one of the the biggest institute of higher education and research in India which was awarded the "Best Private University of the Year" by World Education Congress in 2014 and in 2020 the National Institutional Ranking Framework has ranked Bharath Institute of Higher Education among 59 universities worldwide.

“This is the first precedent of the memorandum between Georgian and Indian higher education institutions. We strongly believe that our cooperation with the Bharath Institute of Higher Education and Research will play a crucial role in the development of our medical program and provide our students and academic staff with unique opportunities. IT and Data Science is a new direction for ALTE University and the knowledge and experience that Bharath University will share with us will be of significant importance for its success. “- commented Ramaz Kukuladze, President, ALTE University.

ALTE University is a fully authorized higher education institution that was founded in 2002 and now unites 2100 students from 12 countries at 4 schools: a school of business, humanities and social sciences, law and international school of medicine. University has an exclusive strategic alliance with the largest healthcare provider in Georgia – “Evex” and Iv. Bokeria University Clinic is Affiliated-clinic of ALTE University.

news.title: Alte University – Member of AMEE
news.description: ALTE University became a member of the International Association for Medical Education (AMEE). The Association for Medical Education in Europe (AMEE) is a worldwide organization with members in 90 countries on five continents
news.content: ALTE University became a member of the International Association for Medical Education (AMEE). The Association for Medical Education in Europe (AMEE) is a worldwide organization with members in 90 countries on five continents. Members include teachers, educators, researchers, administrators, curriculum developers, deans, assessors, students and trainees in medicine and the healthcare professions. It creates a platform that helps every member to get any kind of information about medicine and healthcare. Within the membership, students and universities from 90 countries have an opportunity to arrange joint projects and to take part in international conferences and events.

news.title: Exclusive Memorandum with  Iv. Bokeria Hospital
news.description: An exclusive Memorandum was signed between Bokeria Tbilisi Referral Hospital and ALTE University. This cooperation will support medical profile students to develop professionally and educationally. Within the framework of the partnership, Bokeria Tbilisi Referral Hospital became the University- affiliated Clinic.
news.content:
An exclusive Memorandum was signed between Bokeria Tbilisi Referral Hospital and ALTE University. This cooperation will support medical profile students to develop professionally and educationally. Within the framework of the partnership, Bokeria Tbilisi Referral Hospital became the University- affiliated Clinic. Our students will deepen their practical and theoretical knowledge on the material-technical base of the hospital. Leading doctors of the clinic will be actively involved in the process of teaching. Additionally, top medical staff working abroad will conduct masterclasses for our students. Students who will become the part of International School of Medicine and will start studying at ALTE University will have a unique opportunity to enrol within an internship program at Bokeria Tbilisi Referral Hospital.

What are the priorities of this exclusive memorandum?

 - After successful completion of the first phase of medical school, top 3 students will receive grants for residency education at Iv. Bokeria Clinic.

- Hospital practitioners will be involved in the teaching and program development process.

- Georgian and foreign experts who are working abroad will organize Masterclasses for students.

- Students will have a unique opportunity to have practical experience.

For the new academic year, ALTE University announced the first enrollment for Georgian Students within the International Medical School. Additionally, we have to mention that within the framework of cooperation our university will create Master’s Program of Medical Management, which will help students to form high-quality medical service management in their countries and will give the enrollees the opportunity to develop skills of interdisciplinary management.

Such kind of Cooperation between medical companies and educational institutions is the first case in Georgia. The main aim of exclusive memorandum is to implement new theoretical and practical approaches to keeping up with modern challenges.

news.title: Alte University joined the initiative of the Council of Europe
news.description: Alte University joined the initiative of the Council of Europe and on November 16, at 16:00,held a lecture for university students on "Equality and the Law on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination."  The lecturer was Lado Mkervalishvili, a professor of  Alte University and a member of the Equality Coalition and the executive director of Rights Georgia.
news.content:
Alte University joined the initiative of the Council of Europe and on November 16, at 16:00,held a lecture for university students on "Equality and the Law on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination."

The lecturer was Lado Mkervalishvili, a professor of  Alte University and a member of the Equality Coalition and the executive director of Rights Georgia.

Equality Week is organized by the Council of Europe, partner agencies and organizations as part of the 'I Choose Equality' campaign. The campaign aims to raise awareness of the risks posed by discrimination, hate speech and hate crimes, to disseminate information about the importance of diversity and tolerance and to inform minorities and vulnerable groups about legal mechanisms.

news.title: Our Bachelor's Program has gained full 7-year Accreditation
news.description: Alte University Undergraduate Program in International Relations has been fully accredited by the Higher Education Program Accreditation Board for a period of 7 years. Program accreditation means the evaluation of the program according to the standards set by the Ministry of Education and Science of Georgia.
news.content:
Alte University Undergraduate Program in International Relations has been fully accredited by the Higher Education Program Accreditation Board for a period of 7 years. Program accreditation means the evaluation of the program according to the standards set by the Ministry of Education and Science of Georgia. Compulsory accreditation of educational programs is established by the legislation of Georgia, which is the most important process for each educational institution. Granting accreditation confirms the readiness of the institution and the potential to have a program in line with competitive, national and international standards.

The undergraduate program in International Relations has been updated to meet the demands of the labor market, the best international practices of leading universities, and the high involvement of highly qualified academic and visiting practitioners. Accordingly, the Accreditation Board has established compliance with the program standards and granted full accreditation for a period of 7 years, which primarily reflects on the University as a continuously focused educational institution and students who will enjoy the benefits of the program, which will help them become highly qualified internationally In successful employment in the employment market. " - noted the Dean of the School of Humanities and Social Sciences, Prof. Ketevan Tskhadadze.

The aim of the Alte University Undergraduate Program in International Relations is to prepare a competitive and professional staff in the field of international relations, who will have in-depth knowledge in the most important areas of international relations: international security, international economic relations, international legal order, bilateral and multilateral formats of international relations. Key governance issues. The program provides the student with the development of practical and research skills along with theoretical knowledge.

news.title: MOITANE • მოიტანე
news.description: The story of "Moitane" began in 2019 when some students made their ideas a reality with the help of investments attracted by a startup garage based at alte university. From the day of its inception, the main goal of the company is to simplify the purchasing process for customers and easily supply them with the highest quality products.
news.content:
The story of "Moitane" began in 2019 when some students made their ideas a reality with the help of investments attracted by a startup garage based at alte university. From the day of its inception, the main goal of the company is to simplify the purchasing process for customers and easily supply them with the highest quality products. Through Its Activities, the company helped many families In the conditions of The Pandemic, Because they could buy the desired product without leaving home. Since its inception, the platform has grown rapidly and today successfully serves more than 15,000 families on a monthly basis.
"Moitane" the app and website is quite easy because the platform is sorted by categories and keywords, which greatly simplifies the search process. In addition, the platform integrates a variety of products: food, toys, books, wine shops, pharmacies, agrarian markets, etc. It Is important that the product is completely Georgian, The platform was created by the company "Lemondu" in Georgia, and the team from the first day of its establishment has been taking care of the simplification of "Home Shopping" and is focused on developing functionalities and offering innovations.
It is noteworthy that the investment company "Velox capital" buys the controlling stake of "Moitane" and together with the existing team takes the development of the company to a new level.

news.title: Project Management
news.description: Alte University offers a Project Management course for current and start-up project managers, mid-level managers, and people who have to manage changes and projects of different sizes. The course is designed for anyone who is involved in managing projects and making changes in a company of any size.
news.content:
Alte University offers a Project Management course for current and start-up project managers, mid-level managers, and people who have to manage changes and projects of different sizes. The course is designed for anyone who is involved in managing projects and making changes in a company of any size. Also, for those who consider the proper planning and management of processes in their own activities.
|The course discusses both traditional and modern project management methods and practices—widely used techniques for effective project planning and management.
Based on practical activities and examples, you will learn about and analyze all the components of a project management cycle:

  • Project planning and budgeting;

  • Project team and stakeholder management;

  • Tools for measuring results and monitoring;

  • Cost-based results;

  • Risk identification and management;

All issues within the project are discussed based on modern and practical approaches. Also, cases of successful and unsuccessful projects will be discussed. Interesting emphasis will be placed on how integral values and their essential elements have been integrated into traditional project management methodologies.
During the course, you will learn many important techniques that will help you better manage the project life cycle in practice and create the best experience for the client.
The duration of the project is one month, the cost of the course is 2000 GEL.
 For detailed information about the project please visit the link
 Fill out the application form to register

news.title: Design Thinking
news.description: Alte University offers three days of intensive training in design thinking, one of the fastest-growing fields in the world. Design thinking is a modern discipline of problem-solving, overcoming challenges, and introducing innovations. It masters creative methods, search approaches and stages of thinking from designers in various fields.
news.content:
Alte University offers three days of intensive training in design thinking, one of the fastest-growing fields in the world.

Design thinking is a modern discipline of problem-solving, overcoming challenges, and introducing innovations. It masters creative methods, search approaches and stages of thinking from designers in various fields.

The training has an ambitious goal: to provide in-depth perception, understanding, and mastery of the design thinking approach in 3 days. The intensive course will combine both theoretical and highly important practical training. Training participants will have the opportunity to understand and grasp the contribution of the design thinking process to the transformation and inspiration of organizations or individuals. In addition, each of them will go through all the important stages and learn about the fundamental approaches to the process.

The course is designed for everyone who...

  • Wants to be able to solve problems and regardless of the field;

  • Believes in innovative ideas and wants to adapt to modernity as much as possible;

  • Has a desire to change, improve, and invent something interesting and important;

  • Thinks about how to make their own company, environment, and even country better.


After passing the course, participants ...

  • Be able to incorporate design thinking into any task solving process;

  • You will become more self-confident and believe in your own creative abilities;

  • Understand people better - their emotional, psychological, and physical needs;

  • Learn ideas generation techniques;

  • Develop problem-solving skills;

Design thinkers work successfully under constraints, make human-friendly decisions, bring about positive change for the environment, and always find opportunities in an ever-changing environment.

The course will be held on February 4-6. The cost of the course is 1500 GEL.

For detailed information, visit the link

news.title: Memorandum With Northeastern University
news.description: Alte University officially announces signing of the Memorandum of Understanding between Northeastern University and Alte University. According to the memorandum, the institutions may explore cooperation in various educational activities, including Interaction of faculty, scholars, and students between Institutions;
news.content:
Alte University officially announces signing of the Memorandum of Understanding between Northeastern University and Alte University. According to the memorandum, the institutions may explore cooperation in various educational activities, including Interaction of faculty, scholars, and students between Institutions; arranging joint training, seminars, webinars; educational program partnerships; joint development of curricula and academic projects; collaboration in academic publications and other materials of mutual interest based on the aforementioned activities and etc.

“The collaboration between Northeastern University and Alte University will create a lot of unique opportunities for our students and faculty members. The experience that Northeastern University will share with us will be of significant importance for Georgian educational sphere. I strongly believe that this is just a beginning of very strong, mutually beneficial partnership and various important projects are just ahead of us” – commented Ramaz Kukuladze, President, Alte University.

“I’m excited to offer Northeastern students an experiential opportunity to study the dynamic economic transformation and transculturation processes associated with political change in the field, and examine how Georgia has dealt with the difficult transition from a planned economy to capitalism in the first global experiential learning program stemming from this collaboration between Northeastern and Alte Universities“ - commented Yakov Bart, Associate Professor of Marketing at Northeastern University and Faculty Leader of the Dialogue of Civilizations program titled Georgia: Second Heaven between Europe and Asia.

 Northeastern University Founded in 1898, Northeastern is a global research university and the recognized leader in experience-powered lifelong learning. Our world-renowned experiential approach empowers our students, faculty, alumni, and partners to create impact far beyond the confines of discipline, degree, and campus. Our locations—in Boston; the Massachusetts communities of Burlington and Nahant; Charlotte, North Carolina; London; Portland, Maine; San Francisco; Seattle; Silicon Valley; Toronto; and Vancouver—are nodes in our growing global university system. Through this network, we expand opportunities for flexible, student-centered learning and collaborative, solutions-focused research. Northeastern’s comprehensive array of undergraduate and graduate programs—in on-campus, online, and hybrid formats—lead to degrees through the doctorate in nine colleges and schools. Among these, we offer more than 140 multidisciplinary majors and degrees designed to prepare students for purposeful lives and careers.

news.title: Evaluation of the Participants of the Design Thinking Course
news.description: The design thinking training course was held at Alte University on February 4, 5, and 6, led by Eka Kipiani. After completing the training course, some participants decided to share their impressions of the course.
news.content:
The design thinking training course was held at Alte University on February 4, 5, and 6, led by Eka Kipiani.

Design thinking" is not just the job of a graphic designer. It is a way of thinking, an approach that helps us solve a set task flexibly and originally.

Mentioned Eka Kipiani.

After completing the training course, some participants decided to share their impressions of the course.

Kakha Bregvadze- Head of Business Process Development Service

The path of development goes through creative methods of problem-solving. Design thinking even helps you discover these methods. The knowledge shared during the course significantly helped me to get creative in my professional field. I have worked, refined, and introduced innovative ideas in my own business.

Tamta Pasurishvili- The Banking Project Manager

The design thinking course convinced me that a special idea can be born in anyone's mind. The Design Thinking Course gives business professionals an unprecedented opportunity to explore the emotional, psychological, and physical needs of their customers.. As a result, they can create a unique product and successfully implement various projects.

Keti Shalutashvili- Graphic Designer

The three days of the design thinking course were some of the most productive days of my professional life. The knowledge gained has already been reflected in my work. I'm sure the experience gained on the course will help me take big steps towards success.

news.title: A Workshop on Creating an innovative culture
news.description: A workshop for invited students, the academic and administrative staff was held at Alte University on March 5-7.The aim of the workshop was to get people to start working together to create an innovative culture at the university. The workshop was led by invited professionals from Israel in the field of entrepreneurship.
news.content:
A workshop for invited students, the academic and administrative staff was held at Alte University on March 5-7.
The aim of the workshop was to get people to start working together to create an innovative culture at the university. The workshop was led by invited professionals from Israel in the field of entrepreneurship.
The last meeting of the event was attended by the Ambassador of Israel to Georgia, Ran Gidor, who spoke to the participants about the importance of establishing similar types of workshops and entrepreneurial culture.

news.title: Russia's war on Ukraine
news.description: On March 18, at the initiative of Alte University School of Humanities and Social Sciences, a conference was held on a critical topic - the Russian war in Ukraine.The purpose of the event was to support Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity and to raise awareness of Russian aggression.
news.content:
On March 18, at the initiative of Alte University School of Humanities and Social Sciences, a conference was held on a critical topic - the Russian war in Ukraine.
The purpose of the event was to support Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity and to raise awareness of Russian aggression.
The task of the event was:

  • Analytical assessment of the crisis by experts in the field;

  • Identify and avoid misinformation and propaganda sources;

  • Discuss possible scenarios of events;

Presented a report at the conference: 13:10- 14:30

  • Strategic Analysis of Russia’s War on Ukraine Moderator: Amb. David Sikharulidze, Associate Professor, Alte University;

  • Strategic Assessment of Russia’s War on Ukraine -  Bob Hamilton, U.S. Embassy;

  • Shifting Context of NATO and Black Sea Security - John Bushyhead, US Army Lieutenant Colonel (Ret.), MA in National Security Affairs, US Naval Postgraduate School;

  • Political and Security Dynamics of Russia’s War on Ukraine - Batu Kutelia, Foreign and Security Policy Researcher, Alte University;

  • Legal Merits of Russia’s war on Ukraine - Giga Lemonjava, Head of International Relations Program, Alte University;

  • Cyber Dimension of Russia’s war on Ukraine - Andro Gotsiridze, Cyber Strategy Consultant-researcher;

After the reports, time was devoted to the discussion.

news.title: The Second Stream of Intensive Design Thinking Training
news.description: The second stream of intensive design thinking training course has started.
news.content:
The second stream of intensive design thinking training course has started.

Design thinking is a modern discipline of problem-solving, overcoming challenges, and introducing innovations. It masters creative methods, search approaches and stages of thinking from designers in various fields.

The training has an ambitious goal: to provide in-depth perception, understanding, and mastery of the design thinking approach in 3 days. The intensive course will combine both theoretical and highly important practical training. Training participants will have the opportunity to understand and grasp the contribution of the design thinking process to the transformation and inspiration of organizations or individuals. In addition, each of them will go through all the important stages and learn about the fundamental approaches to the process.

The course is designed for everyone who...

  • Wants to be able to solve problems and regardless of the field

  • Believes in innovative ideas and wants to adapt to modernity as much as possibl 

  • Has a desire to change, improve, and invent something interesting and important

  • Thinks about how to make their own company, environment, and even country better

After passing the course, participants ...

  • Be able to incorporate design thinking into any task solving process

  • You will become more self-confident and believe in your own creative abilities

  • Understand people better - their emotional, psychological, and physical needs

  • Learn ideas generation techniques

  • Develop problem-solving skills

Design thinkers work successfully under constraints, make human-friendly decisions, bring about positive change for the environment, and always find opportunities in an ever-changing environment.

Interested people can register for the course until April 25.

The cost of the course is 1500 GEL.

For detailed information, visit the link

news.description: We are happy to announce the establishment of a Digital Transformation Center at Alte University, headed by Professor Nana Dikhaminjia.  Nana Dikhaminjia has many years of experience in educational research in the fields of mathematics and engineering technology.
news.title: Nana Dikhaminjia - New Team Member of Alte Unversity
news.content:
We are happy to announce the establishment of a Digital Transformation Center at Alte University, headed by Professor Nana Dikhaminjia.  Nana Dikhaminjia has many years of experience in educational research in the fields of mathematics and engineering technology.
She successfully manages both scientific and industrial projects and collaborates with international organizations, foreign universities, and companies in the use and introduction of modern technologies, as well as the development and evaluation of educational programs. 
Nana Dikhaminjia has implemented a number of projects in recent years in the field of digital education for pupils and students, especially in the field of technological empowerment of women.

The goal of the Digital Transformation Center is to facilitate the introduction of modern standards processes at the university and the strengthening of educational programs with the latest technological components and the development of new technological educational programs and training courses. 
The Center will cooperate with local and foreign partners in various fields, such as education, healthcare, technology-engineering industry, public administration, or business, to introduce the latest digital transformation methodologies in Georgia.

news.title: The Winners of the First School Start-up Marathon are Known!
news.description: The annual start-up marathon for pupils is over. Thirteen teams took part in the final stage. Along with project partners, Alte University has identified teams of authors of selected business ideas.
news.content:
The annual start-up marathon for pupils is over. Thirteen teams took part in the final stage. Along with project partners, Alte University has identified teams of authors of selected business ideas.

TBC's favorite team became Robobook. They were given 5000 GEL as a gift. The Robobook team will create an interactive book on robotics that combines theoretical and practical fun exercises.

Alte University awarded a study grant to all team members. In addition, Alte University has identified two selected teams that the university will cooperate with, help to refine the business idea, and attract the necessary investments. These are HeadStart and IAVP (VPP).

has introduced the idea of creating an employment site that will allow young people to easily find interesting jobs. The platform will connect employers and potential employees virtually, enabling both parties to get detailed information about each other very quickly and simplify the so-called match The recruitment process.

also came up with the idea of creating an employment application that would be more student-centered. Through this platform, students will be able to work virtually on projects for different companies in the first stage, get experience and positive evaluation from the employer company, and then be directly employed by these specific companies.

Another favorite team of Alte University became Robobook, university will help them to develop the idea and find additional investments.

Haru - Mariam Natsvlishvili was chosen by the Israeli Embassy and received a laptop as a gift; her business idea is to develop an app that will assist users in overcoming anxiety, depression, and a lack of motivation.

GITA has identified three teams: NBSG, Robobook, and Firelink, GITA will help them with FabLab services and pre-acceleration programs.

The NBSG team has introduced a new type of exoskeleton multifunction device, the NBSG-Nitinol Based Smart Gauntlets, in which the main driving force is a unique feature of nitinol - shape memory effect. The NBSG will act as a support device for patients in rehabilitation, helping the rehabilitated muscle to regain a healthy shape.

Firelink has come up with the idea of creating flying nanosatellites that will monitor to prevent forest fires.

The entrepreneur's favorite team also became NBSG. Entrepreneur Georgia will be an information supporter of NBSG.

news.description: Alte University's Tourism and Hospitality Management undergraduate program has received unconditional accreditation from the National Center for Quality Development in Education (EQE), which means that the program is accredited at the highest level and will fully meet the standards required by the Ministry of Education and Science.
news.title: Tourism and Hospitality Management Program has Received Unconditional Accreditation
news.content:
Alte University's Tourism and Hospitality Management undergraduate program has received unconditional accreditation from the National Center for Quality Development in Education (EQE), which means that the program is accredited at the highest level and will fully meet the standards required by the Ministry of Education and Science.

Note: accreditation is the evaluation of an academic program that determines its compliance with the following standards: the purpose of the educational program, teaching methodology, student achievement, provision of teaching resources, and opportunities for quality teaching development.

news.content:

news.title: Alte University is a Partner of Technovation Girls Sakartvelo
news.description: Technovation Girls is an international technology and entrepreneurship education program that helps 13-18-year-old girls develop the skills needed to become tech entrepreneurs and leaders.
news.content:
Technovation Girls is an international technology and entrepreneurship education program that helps 13-18-year-old girls develop the skills needed to become tech entrepreneurs and leaders.

The project started in January 2022 and was for 4 months. The girls from all regions of Georgia learned coding, entrepreneurship, and teamwork.

On May 13-14, 20 finalist teams for the project gathered at the Georgian Agency for Technology and Innovation. Nana Dikhaminjia, Director of Alte University Digital Transformation Center, awarded symbolic gifts on behalf of Alte University to the 6 winning teams of the project. Of these, 3 teams (14 high school girls) received a study grant from Alte University

news.title: Career Orientation and Future Professions
news.description: Alte University organized workshops on "Career Orientation and Future Professions" in three cities in Georgia: Batumi, Zugdidi, and Kutaisi. Meetings were held with pupils, led by Speaker Mariam Gogava.
news.content:
Alte University organized workshops on "Career Orientation and Future Professions" in three cities in Georgia: Batumi, Zugdidi, and Kutaisi. Meetings were held with pupils, led by Speaker Mariam Gogava.

The meetings were also attended by Ketevan Tskhadadze, Dean of the School of Law, in Kutaisi, Giorgi Koberidze, Acting Dean of the School of Humanities and Social Sciences, in Zugdidi, and Teona Dalakishvili, Head of the Startup Garage, in Batumi.

During the meeting, they talked about Alte University and the opportunities that the university offers to its students.

See photos

news.title: 1st World Conference on Health in Detention
news.description: On June 27-29, the 1st World Conference on Health in Detention will be held in Geneva, organized by the Red Cross Organization.
news.content:
On June 27-29, the 1st World Conference on Health in Detention will be held in Geneva, organized by the Red Cross Organization.

The First World Conference on Health in Detention aims to provide health care professionals and managers working in detention settings, and academics from a range of relevant disciplines with a platform to share their experiences, challenges, lessons learnt and research, and to mutually promote a whole government stewardship approach to health in detention.

Ketevan Chakhnashvili, Dean of the International School of Medicine of Alte University, will participate in the conference as an independent regional expert.

"Being a member and speaker of the organizing committee of such a high-level event is a great honor and responsibility for me. "This is an opportunity to share all my accumulated knowledge and experience and receive information about the best practices in the world in the same way." - mentioned Ketevan Chakhnashvili.

news.description: Alte University won the targeted grant competition for science promotion of the Shota Rustaveli Scientific Foundation.
news.title: MEDICAL TECHNOLOGIES IN SCHOOL - WINNER OF THE GRANT COMPETI... Medical Technologies in School - Winner of the Grant Competition
news.content:
Alte University won the targeted grant competition for science promotion of the Shota Rustaveli Scientific Foundation.

The project aims to interest high school students in medical technologies. For this purpose, the project plans to implement a children's university, in which 50 students from 10 public schools in Tbilisi will study. Within the Children's University, students will learn about the latest advances and applications of telemedicine, bioinformatics, and medical wearables; learn the basics of electronics and programming, and create prototypes of Arduino-based medical wearables. The project will end with a scientific exhibition competition, where together with the schools involved in the project, other schools will have the opportunity to present the project created by his team in the direction of medical technologies. Acceptance of schools in the project will be announced in September.

The head of the project is Nana Dikhaminjia, the director of the Digital Transformation Center of Alte University; the project coordinator is Ketevan Chakhnashvili, the dean of the Medical School of Alte University. Associate Professor of Computer Sciences Salome Oniani will lead the engineering training, and Theona Dalakishvili, the head of the Startup Garage, will conduct the technological entrepreneurship training.

The project will be consulted by Georgian scientists working in Silicon Valley: bioinformatician Tsotne Chitiashvili (Calico) and bioinformatician Davit Managadze (DNAnexus).

news.title: Micro Master of Strategic Management
news.description: Study at the Strategic Management Micro Master program at "Alte University".  Within the framework of the program, you will have the opportunity to deepen your knowledge, study the directions necessary for a manager in any field, and acquire new skills.
news.content:
Study at the Strategic Management Micro Master program at "Alte University".

Within the framework of the program, you will have the opportunity to deepen your knowledge, study the directions necessary for a manager in any field, and acquire new skills. The program includes six main directions:

  • Strategic management-lecturer: Vano Baliashvili;

  • Operations management and new technologies-lecturer: Giorgi Mkheidze;

  • Management of organizational changes-lecturer: Maia Sichinava; 

  • Design thinking-lecturer: Dan Kogan;

  • Organizational behavior-lecturer: Natia Mefarishvili;

  • Marketing-lecturer: Giorgi Barkalaia;


The cost of the Strategic Management Micro Master program is 1950 GEL.

Duration: three months

In the case of registration for a separate subject, the price of each course is 400 GEL.

within the framework of the Strategic Management Micro Master program, it is possible to choose additional directions.

  • Structural archetypal branding - Khatuna Tavdgiridze, price: 400 GEL, Duration: three months

  • Social Media Marketing - Tamar Chilachava,  price: 400 GEL, Duration: three months

  • Statistics and data analysis - Mariam Chanturia, price: 400 GEL, Duration: three months

Mentors for the Strategic Management Micro Master Program:

Vano Baliashvili

Subject: strategic management

Vano is a Bachelor of Economics from Tbilisi State University, Master of Business Administration from ESM Tbilisi, and Master of Project Management from George Washington University, He worked as the operations director of "TBS Bank" and is currently a business consultant in several countries around the world.

Giorgi Mkheidze

Subject: operations management and new technologies

At different times, Giorgi Mkheidze worked in the management positions of "The Bank of Georgia" and "Evex Hospitals".

Maia sichinava

Subject: management of organizational changes

Maia Sichinava holds a master's degree in business administration from Caucasus Business School and Grenoble Business School. She worked in the top positions of Bank Republika, Societe Generale, and nowadays she is the head of sales and business development of "Solo".

Dan Cogan

Subject: Design Thinking

Dan Kogan is Open Valley Israel's entrepreneurship education expert. He is an experienced technology and social entrepreneur, mentor, and workshop facilitator. Dan researches and teaches practical innovation and game-changing methodologies.

Natia Mefarishvili

Subject: organizational behavior

The former head of marketing and PR of the Georgian Chamber of Commerce and Industry, expert of "The European Union of Georgia" and chairman of "The Women Business Council in Georgia. 

Giorgi Barkalaya

Subject: Marketing

At different times, he was the chief marketing and public relations specialist of "Visol Petroleum Georgia", "Arti Group", Bank of Georgia Group, LLC "Georgia Lottery Company" and JSC "VTB Bank Georgia".

news.title: Alte University has Lunched a Certificate Course in Angular in Depth
news.description: With the support of USAID's Economic Security Program, Alte University is launching a certificate course in Angular for experienced and novice IT professionals.
news.content:
With the support of USAID's Economic Security Program, Alte University is launching a certificate course in Angular for experienced and novice IT professionals.

The goal of the joint course of Alte University and USAID's Economic Security Program is to respond to the challenge in Georgia, which is related to the shortage of professional personnel in the IT field. It is essential to actively involve interested people from different regions of Georgia in the project; among them, particular emphasis is placed on the involvement of women. Most successful graduates will have the opportunity to practice in one of Georgia's most prominent leading companies, receive a certificate, and master one of the most demanding and well-paid professions.

"We are delighted to partner with Alte University to support thirty experienced and aspiring IT professionals to improve their Angular skills, helping them land high-paying positions in the ICT sector." Acquired skills will give each course participant many opportunities and create a suitable learning environment where they will get theoretical knowledge and valuable experience. Said Mark McCord, head of USAID's economic security program.

Registration for the certificate program will begin on September 27. The participants will be selected in two stages—as a result of the testing and individual interviews. The selected candidates will start studying for the 6-month program in early November. The number of participants is limited, and their selection will be based on individual interviews

Interested persons should register at the given link

news.title: Advisory to Indian Students Seeking Admission in Georgia
news.description: SPECIAL ANNOUNCEMENT OF THE PRESIDENT OF ALTE UNIVERSITY REGARDING “ADVISORY TO INDIAN STUDENTS SEEKING ADMISSION IN GEORGIA”
news.content:
SPECIAL ANNOUNCEMENT OF THE PRESIDENT OF ALTE UNIVERSITY REGARDING “ADVISORY TO INDIAN STUDENTS SEEKING ADMISSION IN GEORGIA”

Respected students planning to start medical studies in Georgia, on September 15, 2022, the Embassy of India, in Yerevan published “Advisory to Indian Students Seeking Admission in Georgia”

After reviewing the above-mentioned document, several points that are inconsistent with the Law of Georgia on Medical Practice were discovered. This misinformation can be misleading for the applicants and families seeking medical education. We, alongside with the other educational institutions in Georgia, are working closely with the Georgian Authorities to have a corrected version of the answers communicated to the Embassy of India and a new Advisory published as soon as possible.

Before a corrected advisory is published,we would like to provide clarification and correct answers to the questions addressed in the document.

In response to the various queries received from Indian students, the following are the few answers provided by the Georgian authorities, for information of all concerned:

I) What is the duration of the Undergraduate Medical (MD) Program in Georgia for Indian students?

Ans: Following national legislation and related regulations on higher medical education and Medical Sector Benchmarks, which is mandatory to be fulfilled in order to get state accreditation, the duration of undergraduate MD programs in Georgia is 6 years (360 ECTS) including internship during the 6th, graduating year.

II) What is the duration of Internship/Clinical rotations in the medical course (MD)?

Ans: Up to 3rd course, the students take fundamental and basic pre-clinical subjects, acquire clinical skills in Clinical Skills Centers. Starting from the 4th year of study, MD students start clinical rotations. During 9-12th semesters (5thand 6th years of study) students have clerkships/internship in clinical settings (university hospitals, teaching hospitals, primary care settings that meet requirements stipulated by national regulations and Sector benchmarks in Medicine), the 6th year completely comprises studies in clinical environment. Clinical clerkships/internship during this period of study comprise 120 ECTS.

III) Do medical universities in Georgia provide internships in the same medical university hospitals and Indian Students (MD students) allowed to do internship in Georgia?

Ans: All medical schools in Georgia provide the same clinical settings (university hospitals, affiliated teaching hospitals, primary care settings) for all MD students for their clinical studies regardless of their nationality and citizenship. Some of the Higher Educational Institutions (HEI) do have their own university clinics in Georgia, and those who do not own the clinic/hospital, usually sign the MoUs with several clinics. Such agreements shall indicate the medical field to be served, number of students to enroll on traineeship, duration of internship, etc. Indian students and other foreign nationals have the same rights as Georgians to take these clinical courses following and fulfilling the general curriculum of the program. If they wish to undergo extra clinical activities/internships at other clinics, this can be facilitated in agreement with the HEI and clinics themselves and it always helps if the students know the local language in order to communicate with the patients. All medical schools/universities MD programs provide the Georgian language course for international students within their curricula to facilitate communication with patients.

IV) Are Indian medical students allowed to touch the patients and practice during the internship/clinical rotations?

Ans: All students in Georgia, regardless of their nationality, are allowed to perform physical examination and certain medical procedures, determined by the educational curriculum, on the patients under the supervision of their instructor and after obtaining informed consent from the patient (according to the Law of Georgia on Patients’ Rights).

V) Does an Indian (MD) student get registered under any professional regulatory body or otherwise under any institution that is competent to grant a license at par to the citizens of Georgia?

Ans: Indian MD students as well as other MD students regardless their nationality who study in accredited and authorized medical schools/universities by accredited agency NCEQE (National Center for Educational Quality Enhancement), which is internationally recognized as accredited Agency by World Federation of Medical Education (WFME, https://wfme.org/download/list-agencies-recognition-status-applying/?wpdmdl=1936&refresh=632b23a563a371663771557 ) are registered by the Ministry of Education and Science of Georgia. International accreditation implies that all MD diplomas of graduates accredited by NCEQE MD programs in Georgia are recognized worldwide (like obtaining “tickets” for continuation their medical career in any other country).

According to Georgia legislation, Graduates of MD program have the right:

a) to be employed as a junior doctor – position that may be occupied by a MD graduate from state-accredited higher medical institution who shall perform the duties of a doctor according to the instructions and under the supervision (Article 5 - Law of Georgia On Medical Practice, https://matsne.gov.ge/en/document/view/15334?publication=17 )

b) to take the postgraduate residency course and after passing the Unified State Certification Exam get the right of independent medical practice (Article 17, Law of Georgia on Medical Practice),

c) to continue doctoral studies (i.e., research career in biomedical sciences leading to PHD degree, comprising 3 years), engage in pedagogical and/or scientific activities (Article 17, Law of Georgia on Medical Practice).

After passing NPDQE graduates are allowed to continue with postgraduate studies/residency at the clinics/hospitals that are accredited by the Ministry of Health to provide such residency programs (in specialized fields of medicine). The national post-diploma qualification exam for MD graduates is administered by the Medical and Pharmaceutical Regulation Agency, operating under the guidance of the Ministry of Health of Georgia.

After completion residency license for independence medical practice is granted by the Ministry of Internally Displaced persons from the occupied territories, Labour, Health and Social Affairs of Georgia (abbr. Ministry of Health of Georgia) regardless of nationality and citizenship of residency graduates.

VI) Does an Indian (MD) student allowed to get a license to practice in Georgia as a medical practitioner?If yes, what is the process?

Ans: Based on aforementioned, Indian (MD) students after graduation of undergraduate studies can work as junior doctors, or they can pass NPDQE, take the track of residency program on specialty they choose and get the license for running independent medical practice according the following regulations:

A student of a higher medical educational institution, a medical resident, a physician job seeker, a junior doctor regardless of nationality, have rights to perform the duties of a doctor according to Law of Georgia on Medical Education (Article 14 - Law of Georgia on Medical Practice) https://matsne.gov.ge/en/document/view/15334?publication=17  “

ADVISORY TO INDIAN STUDENTS SEEKING ADMISSION IN GEORGIA”

We hope this letter provides clear guidance to all students seeking medical education in Georgia.

For additional information, please refer to Law of Georgia on Medical Practice, https://matsne.gov.ge/en/document/view/15334 ?publication=17


Sincerely,


Ramaz Kukuladze President | Alte University

news.title: Acceptance of Scientific Articles
news.description: The acceptance of scientific articles for the annual scientific journal of Alte University (second annual edition) is announced. The magazine is bilingual and is published in Georgian and English.
news.content:
The acceptance of scientific articles for the annual scientific journal of Alte University (second annual edition) is announced. The magazine is bilingual and is published in Georgian and English.

The journal will be assigned an ISSN code.

Articles submitted for publication in the scientific journal of Alte University will undergo a two-stage peer review by experts in the field. In case of differences between experts' conclusions, the article will be sent to a third reviewer for evaluation. Articles will be published if a positive review is received. The author(s) of the article will be responsible for the opinions expressed in the article.

Articles for Alte University's 2022 scientific journal will be accepted in the following areas: international relations, security policy, psychology, journalism, law, economics, business administration, tourism, medicine,  technologies and natural sciences.

Academic staff of higher education institutions, independent researchers, and research centers can submit articles for the scientific journal. A scientific article can have one or several authors.

The authors of selected articles will receive 500 gels.

Applicants must submit scientific articles to research@alte.edu.ge by January 15, 2023.

Technical characteristics of a scientific article:

  • A scientific article should be between 1,300 and 1,800 words.

  • Microsoft Word document format 

  • Paper size- A4

  • Font -Sylfaen

  • Size - 12

  • Space - 1.5

  • Spacing between fields – 1 inch (2.54 cm)

  • Pages should be numbered

The title page of a scientific article should contain the following data:

  • Name and surname of the author/co-authors

  • Name of higher educational institution/research center

  • Academic position or scientific degree of the author/co-authors

  • The title of the paper

The scientific article should be presented in the following format:

  • Summary - no more than 200 words

  • Keywords - 8-10 words

  • Introduction 

  • The main part of the topic

  • Conclusion

  • Used literature Attachments (if any)

  • The paper should be formatted in APA style

  • All submitted papers will be checked for plagiarism

Authors of articles will receive an answer about the publication of their article within 1 month from the deadline.

news.title: Alte University Became a Member of Harvard Business School
news.description: Alte University has become a member of the "Microeconomics and Competitiveness Partner Network" of the Harvard Business School (HBS) Institute for Strategy and Competitiveness. As of 2021, the network is represented by 130 educational and business institutions in 67 countries worldwide.
news.content:
Alte University has become a member of the "Microeconomics and Competitiveness Partner Network" of the Harvard Business School (HBS) Institute for Strategy and Competitiveness. As of 2021, the network is represented by 130 educational and business institutions in 67 countries worldwide. It brings together 2,258 courses and 70,000 students in the interests of national, regional, and international cooperation, expert knowledge sharing, joint course planning, and research.


Membership in the "Microeconomics and Competition Partners Network" is an essential innovation for Alte University students and academic staff. Within the framework of cooperation, on the one hand, lecturers are given a unique opportunity to engage in the scientific-research activities of Harvard University Business School, share the experience of Harvard Business School, and introduce relevant modern and innovative practices in Alte University Business School, which will become another source of international-level education for students. On the other hand, both academic staff and students will have access to educational resources located on closed platforms of Harvard University Business School (various innovative business situation analyses, electronic materials, lecture materials of Harvard University professors, etc.), Which means access to the richest base of the latest research and materials available in the sector.


Alte University is represented in this network by Maya Guntsadze, professor and affiliated doctor of the business school, and Giga Kikoria, lecturer of the business school of Alte University.


"This opportunity is significant for me as a lecturer because today, the microeconomics of competitiveness and the research of its determining factors or the identification of best practices are the subject of scientific research and high interest. By joining the network, Alte University Business School lecturers have been given the opportunity to develop and implement relevant courses on the basis of the university, as well as to implement joint research or other projects with the participation of network members from various countries around the world, which increases our students' unique access to higher quality education. Notes Maya guntsadze – associate professor at alte university.

news.description: School of Humanities and Social Sciences of Alte University, with the support of the US Embassy, provides the translation into Georgian of the famous American author Paul Williams' book - Security Studies: An Introduction (3rd Edition).
news.title: Alte University is Translating Paul William's Book - Security Studies: An Introduction (3rd Edition).
news.content:
School of Humanities and Social Sciences of Alte University, with the support of the US Embassy, provides the translation into Georgian of the famous American author Paul Williams' book - Security Studies: An Introduction (3rd Edition).

The American Authors Book Translation Grant Competition is announced annually by the US Embassy, and the goal is to increase access to the latest research, textbooks, and contemporary popular literature for Georgian students, researchers, and interested parties.

Paul Williams is a famous expert in security research. And this book is about the theoretical and practical aspects of security studies. The translation of the mentioned book into Georgian is important since similar scientific literature is available in very small quantities.

events.title: Competition For A Mock Jury Trial For Schoolchildren
events.description: A competition of mock trials for schoolchildren is organized by Alte University and supported by the High School of Justice.
events.content:
A competition of mock trials for schoolchildren is organized by Alte University and supported by the High School of Justice.
The competition aims to help schoolchildren realize the importance of a jury, learn about the trial proceedings under the supervision of qualified facilitators, and participate in an example of a legal case in a process close to reality.

Participation can:

  • Graduates of private and public schools;

  • The team may consist of two or three students from the same school;

  • The team must have a name.


The mock trial competition consists of the following stages:

  • First stage: group registration (March 1-10)

  • Second stage: training for registered groups (March 14-15) introduction to the case and redistribution of roles;

  • The third stage – oral rounds (mock process) – consists of the first and final rounds.

  • First Round-March 17-18

  • Second Round: March 2: Award Ceremony

Registered groups will be trained about the importance of a jury trial. Participants will receive general knowledge, recommendations from practicing lawyers, set up mock trials, and combine the roles of trial participants.
Mock trials will be held in the mock courtroom of Alte University.

The oral rounds will be evaluated by the "judges," which consists of 3 members:

  • One member is a representative of the High School of Justice;

  • one member is a representative of the General Prosecutor's Office; 

  • one member is a representative of Alte University School of Law.

All participating teams will receive gifts and certificates.The winners will be announced in the following nominations:

  • The best prosecution;

  • The best defense side;

Visit the link toregister.

events.title: RUSSIA’S WAR ON UKRAINE
events.description: On March 18, Alte University's School of Humanities and Social Sciences initiated a conference on a critical topic—the Russian War in Ukraine.
events.content:
On March 18, Alte University's School of Humanities and Social Sciences initiated a conference on a critical topic—the Russian War in Ukraine.
The conference will be opened by Mariam Mikiashvili - post-Communist Europe and Central Asia security, identity, and governance researcher, University of St Andrews School of International Relations;


The purpose of the event is to support Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity and to raise awareness of Russian aggression.
The task of the event:

  • Analytical assessment of the crisis by experts in the field;

  • Identify and avoid sources of misinformation and propaganda;

  • Discuss possible scenarios of events;


Event Schedule


13:10- 14:30 - Strategic Analysis of Russia’s War on Ukraine Moderator: Amb. David Sikharulidze, Associate Professor, Alte University;


Strategic Assessment of Russia’s War on Ukraine -  Bob Hamilton [TBC], U.S. Embassy;


Shifting Context of NATO and Black Sea Security - John Bushyhead, US Army Lieutenant Colonel (Ret.), MA in National Security Affairs, US Naval Postgraduate School;


Political and Security Dynamics of Russia’s War on Ukraine - Batu Kutelia, Foreign and Security Policy Researcher, Alte University;


Legal Merits of Russia’s war on Ukraine - Giga Lemonjava, Head of International Relations Program,Alte University;


Cyber Dimension of Russia’s war on Ukraine - Andro Gotsiridze, Cyber Strategy Consultant-researcher;

After the presentations, time will be devoted to the discussion.

events.title: The Laws Of War In Ukraine
events.content:
On May 9, Alte University School of Law will hold a webinar "on the law of war in Ukraine". The webinar is dedicated to the Russian war in Ukraine. In particular, experts in international law discuss the problematic issues of the validity of the law of war in connection with the ongoing war in Ukraine.

Speakers:

  • Introductory remarks and webinar moderator

    Dr. Natia Kalandarishvili-Mueller, Professor of International Law, Alte University.

  • Compliance with IHL

    Dr. Annyssa Bellal, Senior Researcher, Centre on Conflict, Development and Peacebuilding (CCDP), Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies.

  • Sieges under international humanitarian law

    Emanuela-Chiara Gillard, Senior Research Fellow, Oxford Institute for Ethics, Law and Armed Conflict, University of Oxford.

  • The rhetoric of denazification under the law of occupation

    Dr. Marco Longobardo, Senior Lecturer in International Law, University of Westminster.

  • The role of (International) Criminal Law: legal issues

    Dr. iur. Roberta Arnold, LLM, attorney, Adjunct Professor of Law, Franklin University Switzerland ; International Fellow at the National Institute of Military Justice (US).

The webinar will be conducted online.

At the end of the webinar, there will be a discussion during which guests will have the opportunity to ask the desired questions.

Those interested in war crimes and international law may attend.

To attend the webinar, register at the link.

events.title: Marathon „20-200“
events.description: On July 28-29, Alte University will hold a marathon "20-200" as part of the start-up summer at Era Square.
events.content:
On July 28-29, Alte University will hold a marathon "20-200" as part of the start-up summer at Era Square.

Participants of the marathon are tasked with developing a business idea that will increase the initial capital of 20 GEL to at least 200 GEL and accumulate the largest profit. The marathon is held at Era Square from 10:00 AM to 8:00 PM. Teams have the right to negotiate with companies before the marathon to obtain support from them, which can be both monetary and other resources (production, service, etc.)

In this case, the team must submit relevant documentation to the project organizers. Teams have the right to put the money earned during the day back into production and create a product on the spot during the day. The product or service can be of any kind. The main thing in this activity is the development of entrepreneurial competence in a short time with limited resources. 

After the marathon, the startup garage's maker space will be launched, where the project participants, together with Altes mentors, representatives of Technopark, and the American corner of Batumi, will provide mentoring on the following topics:

  • The development of an idea

  • product development


The Startup Garage will be located at Era Square (Batumi), where any interested young person can come and work on their own idea, familiarize themselves with Fablab's services on the spot, and, if necessary, use these services.

To participate in the Startup Marathon, please register at the link before July 25

events.content:
On October 17, Alte University will hold a forum under the auspices of the Center for Law and Economics, which will touch on the impact of technological advances on the law.

The speaker of the forum will be Professor Zviad Gabisonia, on the topic: "The Impact of Modern Technology on Law: Artificial Intelligence and Internet Law in a Post-Industrial Society."

At the same time, there will be a presentation and discussion about the book "Internet Law and Artificial Intelligence," published by Professor Gabisonia.

In the Georgian legal scientific reality, this is the first case of the creation of a sectoral guide in this field, which in turn lays the foundation for the formation of the mentioned field of law as an independent legal body.

Interested lawyers (jurists, judges, advocates, students) and people interested in technology can attend the event.

events.content:

Professor Natia Kalandarishvili-Müller of Alte University Law School will hold a public discussion. The discussion will concern Russia's war against Ukraine. In particular, what international legal obligations does Russia have toward Ukraine? The speaker discusses the problematic aspects of international law in force during war in the context of international humanitarian law and human rights law.

Any person interested in the issue can attend the discussion.

events.content:
As part of human rights week, a public discussion on the topic "Russian military aggression and internally displaced persons" is being held at Alte University on December 7.

The public debate will focus on Russia's military aggression in Georgia and Ukraine, as well as the consequences, particularly the legal status of internally displaced persons from occupied and annexed territories.


The main speaker of the event will be the associate professor of "Alte University," Giga Lemonjava, and the moderator - the dean of the law school, Ketevan Tskhadadze. After the discussion, an exhibition and sale of items made by Ukrainian IDPs living in Georgia will be held at the university.

On February 26, Alte University and the entrants' club will hold a Georgian workshop, within the framework of which Nino Kenkebashvili will give you advice and teach you how to deal with the Georgian exam.

Nino Kenkebashvili is a senior teacher at the 157th public school and a trainer of the education center "Renome".  

To participate, register at the link.

events.content:

events.title: What Is Your Alte?
events.description: On March 28, at Alte University, personal development specialist and coach Gvantsa Barabadze will hold a workshop for entrants on the topic: What is your Alte?
events.content:
On March 28, at Alte University, personal development specialist and coach Gvantsa Barabadze will hold a workshop for entrants on the topic: What is your Alte?

At the meeting, we will think about and discuss the question, "Who am I? "And what do I want? What opportunities do I have? What prevents me from moving forward?

If you are interested, register for the workshop; the number of participants is limited.

events.title: Essay Competition - Bullying
events.description: The Students' Club and the School of Humanities and Social Sciences of Alte University announce an essay competition for school students.
events.content:
The Students' Club and the School of Humanities and Social Sciences of Alte University announce an essay competition for school students.

Topic: Bullying

The purpose of the competition is to raise pupils' awareness about bullying.

It is important that the author of the essay presents his vision and attitude on how to solve the problem.

This essay should be prepared:

  • In Georgian;

  • Word format, Sylfaen font, size 12;

  • Essay should be at least 350 and at most 500 words; 

  • Author's name, surname;

  • School/class;

  • City/village of residence,

  • Telephone number and the title of the essay.

The essay must send to the following e-mail: schools@alte.edu.ge, until March 31.

Based on the assessment of the special commission, the authors of the best essays will be awarded.

Winners will be announced in the Entrants Club, on April 5th.

events.title: Career Hunter
events.description: From April 7 to 9, by Alte University and the entrants' club will be organized a camp for pupils. The topic of the camp: is "Career Hunter: Discover Your Profession."
events.content:
From April 7 to 9, by Alte University and the entrants' club will be organized a camp for pupils.

The topic of the camp: is "Career Hunter: Discover Your Profession."

11th and 12th-grade pupils from any part of Georgia can participate in the camp.

The camp is fully covered by Alte University.

To participate, you must become a member of the entrants' club and fill out the application form.

The registration deadline is March 27.

events.title: Tourism Industry Trends: Opportunities And Challenges

events.content:
The next invited guest in the series of meetings, "who shares with you," is Elene Otarashvili, the general manager of Golden Tulip Design Tbilisi.

The topic of the meeting: Tourism Industry Trends: Opportunities and Challenges.

The meeting will concern the modern challenges and trends of the tourism industry. Elene Otarashvili will answer the questions of interested entrants, tourism students, and other guests.

Register to participate.

events.title: Introduction To Electronics
events.description: The IT School of Alte University will hold the training "Introduction to Electronics".
events.content:
The IT School of Alte University will hold the training "Introduction to Electronics".

In the framework of the training, students of classes X, XI, and XII will get acquainted with the principles of operation of a microcontroller, the basics of electronics, and the principles of operation of electronic devices.

Participants will create electrical circuits for devices based on the Arduino Uno microcontroller, write program codes, and create small projects by using them.

Register at the link to participate.
